title: Buena Vista Social Club - At Carnegie Hall 2008 (Ry Cooder)
description:
Ã¢â‚¬Å“Buena Vista Social ClubÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, featuring Ibrahim Ferrer, Ruben Gonzalez, Eliades Ochoa, AmarÃƒÂ¡ Portuondo, Compay Segundo, and produced by Ry Cooder, went on to win a Grammy and become the top-selling world music album of all time.
 
When the musicians who participated on the album appeared together on stage at New YorkÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Carnegie Hall on July 1st 1998, it was an event celebrating not only Ry Cooder's vision but the glory of Cuba's golden age of music.

Buena Vista Social Club was not a band in the traditional sense - many of these musicians had never played together before the sessions for the first album and some had never even met. When they took the stage for the only performances that this band would ever play together, however, they come together seamlessly. Part of the credit must go to Ry Cooder, who directs the band without stealing the spotlight, and also Compay Segundo, a charismatic frontman who pulls everyone together through the sheer force of his personality.
 
The recording of Ã¢â‚¬Å“At Carnegie HallÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is immaculate, the performance breathtaking. It's just a sheer pleasure to listen to so many talented musicians make beautiful and enchanting music. Highly recommended.
